animation-mixer.description: A list of available animations can usually be found by inspecting the model file or its documentation. All animations will play by default. To play only a specific set of animations, use wildcards: animation-mixer='clip: run_*'. More properties at https://github.com/n5ro/aframe-extras/tree/master/src/loaders#animation

clampWhenFinished.description: If true, halts the animation at the last frame.

clip.description: Name of the animation clip(s) to play. Accepts wildcards.

crossFadeDuration.description: Duration of cross-fades between clips, in seconds.

duration.description: Duration of the animation, in seconds (0 = auto).

loop.description: once, repeat, or pingpong. In repeat and pingpong modes, the clip plays once plus the specified number of repetitions. For pingpong, every second clip plays in reverse.

repetitions.description: Number of times to play the clip, in addition to the first play (empty string = Infinity). Repetitions are ignored for loop: once.

startAt.description: Sets the start of an animation to a specific time (in milliseconds). This is useful when you need to jump to an exact time in an animation. The input parameter will be scaled by the mixer's timeScale.

timeScale.description: Scaling factor for playback speed. A value of 0 causes the animation to pause. Negative values cause the animation to play backwards.

animation-mixer.title: Animation Mixer

gltf-model-lod.description: Simple switch between the default gltf-model and a detailed one when a user camera is within specified distance

detailedUrl.title: detailedUrl

detailedDistance.title: detailedDistance
detailedDistance.description: At what distance to switch between the models

updateRate.title: updateRate
updateRate.description: How often user camera is checked for LOD (default 333ms)

retainCache.title: retainCache
retainCache.description: Whether to skip freeing the detailed model from browser cache (default false)

gltf-model-lod.title: GLTF Model Level of Detail

modelUpdate.description: The GLTF-specific `modelUpdate` attribute is an object with child component names as keys. The top-level keys are the names of the child components to be updated. The values of each are nested `position` and `rotation` attributes to set as new values, respectively. Either `position` or `rotation` can be omitted if unchanged.

^[a-zA-Z]*.description: One of this model's named child components.
